parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

description: A special-purpose domain that contains comments that may be collected alongside other data. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C49569, 2021-06-25)

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.
fields.label: Study Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: STUDYID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.
fields.label: Study Site Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: SITEID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
fields.definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. \n EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.
fields.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: SUBJID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.implementationNotes: If an additional free-text field is needed to provide more information about a particular record, use the COVAL variable to collect the free text, and associate the free text (comment) with the original record using RDOMAIN, IDVAR, IDVARVAL.
fields.label: Comment
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. RDOMAIN contains the domain to which the comment is related.
fields.name: COVAL
fields.prompt: [Abbreviated version of the protocol-specified targeted question]

label: Comments
name: CO
